resource.description: The AWS::CUR::ReportDefinition resource creates a Cost & Usage Report with user-defined settings. You can use this resource to define settings like time granularity (hourly, daily, monthly), file format (Parquet, CSV), and S3 bucket for delivery of these reports.

properties.name: ReportName
properties.description: The name of the report that you want to create. The name must be unique, is case sensitive, and can't include spaces.

type.description: The name of the report that you want to create. The name must be unique, is case sensitive, and can't include spaces.

properties.name: TimeUnit
properties.description: The granularity of the line items in the report.

type.description: The granularity of the line items in the report.

properties.name: Format
properties.description: The format that AWS saves the report in.

type.description: The format that AWS saves the report in.

properties.name: Compression
properties.description: The compression format that AWS uses for the report.

type.description: The compression format that AWS uses for the report.

properties.name: AdditionalSchemaElements
properties.description: A list of strings that indicate additional content that Amazon Web Services includes in the report, such as individual resource IDs.

type.description: A list of strings that indicate additional content that Amazon Web Services includes in the report, such as individual resource IDs.

itemType.description: Whether or not AWS includes resource IDs in the report.

properties.name: S3Bucket
properties.description: The S3 bucket where AWS delivers the report.

type.description: The S3 bucket where AWS delivers the report.

properties.name: S3Prefix
properties.description: The prefix that AWS adds to the report name when AWS delivers the report. Your prefix can't include spaces.

type.description: The prefix that AWS adds to the report name when AWS delivers the report. Your prefix can't include spaces.

properties.name: S3Region
properties.description: The region of the S3 bucket that AWS delivers the report into.

type.description: The region of the S3 bucket that AWS delivers the report into.

properties.name: AdditionalArtifacts
properties.description: A list of manifests that you want Amazon Web Services to create for this report.

type.description: A list of manifests that you want Amazon Web Services to create for this report.

itemType.description: The types of manifest that you want AWS to create for this report.

properties.name: RefreshClosedReports
properties.description: Whether you want Amazon Web Services to update your reports after they have been finalized if Amazon Web Services detects charges related to previous months. These charges can include refunds, credits, or support fees.

type.description: Whether you want Amazon Web Services to update your reports after they have been finalized if Amazon Web Services detects charges related to previous months. These charges can include refunds, credits, or support fees.

properties.name: ReportVersioning
properties.description: Whether you want Amazon Web Services to overwrite the previous version of each report or to deliver the report in addition to the previous versions.

type.description: Whether you want Amazon Web Services to overwrite the previous version of each report or to deliver the report in addition to the previous versions.

properties.name: BillingViewArn
properties.description: The Amazon resource name of the billing view. You can get this value by using the billing view service public APIs.

type.description: The Amazon resource name of the billing view. You can get this value by using the billing view service public APIs.
